doc.after: The first 10 aircraft were designated "B-47A", and were strictly evaluation aircraft. The first was delivered in December 1950. The configuration of the B-47As was close to that of the initial XB-47 prototypes. They were fitted with J47-GE-11 turbojets, offering the same 5,200Â lbf (23Â kN) thrust as the earlier J47-GE-3, and they also featured the built-in RATO bottles.[26]
